review.title: A Hybrid Model for Enhancing Lexical Statistical Machine Translation (SMT)
review.abstract: The interest in statistical machine translation systems increases currently due to political and social events in the world. A proposed Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) based model that can be used to translate a sentence from the source Language (English) to the target language (Arabic) automatically through efficiently incorporating different statistical and Natural Language Processing (NLP) models such as language model, alignment model, phrase based model, reordering model, and translation model. These models are combined to enhance the performance of statistical machine translation (SMT). Many implementation tools have been used in this work such as Moses, Gizaa++, IRSTLM, KenLM, and BLEU. Based on the implementation, evaluation of this model, and comparing the generated translation with other implemented machine translation systems like Google Translate, it was proved that this proposed model has enhanced the results of the statistical machine translation, and forms a reliable and efficient model in this field of research.

sections.text: A proposed statistical machine translation (SMT) model that can be used to automatically translate a sentence from the source language (English) to the target language (Arabic) by efficiently integrating various statistical and natural language processing models (NLP), such as language model, alignment model, phrase model, reordering model and translation model. These models are combined to improve the performance of statistical machine translation (SMT). Many implementation tools have been used in this work, such as Moses, Gizaa + +, IRSTLM, KenLM and BLEU. Based on the implementation, evaluation of this model and comparison of the generated translation with other implemented machine translation systems such as Google Translate, this proposed model has been proven to improve the results of statistical machine translation and to form a reliable and efficient model in this research area. Keywords: Machine Learning, Statistical Translation, Machine Translation.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) deals with the automatic assignment of sentences in one human language to another human language. Therefore, it translates from the source language to the target language. SMT aims to analyze automatically existing human sentence translations in order to develop general translation rules. Machine translation has not yet been solved. A lot of research and development work is still needed to achieve the reliability of humans by providing a fluent translation as in humans. Therefore, a method was used to adjust the translation parameters and improve the translation quality.

sections.text: In general, many models have been used in machine translation for many years. sections.heading: 6. Conclusions
sections.text: The proposed model in this essay efficiently incorporates many models at different levels, namely: the language model, the alignment model, the phrase model, the reordering model, the translation model, and finally the tuning model. It was found that the benefits achieved from using these models are summarized as follows: The alignment models are used in statistical machine translation to determine the translation correspondences between words in a sentence in a language with words in a sentence with the same meaning in another language. Language models increase the efficiency of word alignment by using words depending on their context within the sentence. Phrase-based model increases the ability of the proposed model by handling words and their equivalents or phrases in both languages at the same time. It increases the effectiveness of this model by translating a group of contiguous words into one language by forming a final sequence of words in the other language.

sections.heading: 7. FUTURE WORK
sections.text: The problem of machine translation is not yet solved. A lot of research and development is still needed to earn the reliability of humans by preforming a fluent translation like that of humans. Demand for faster and cheaper translation between languages will only increase with the need for information exchange between nations. Based on this work, future work and recommendations are expected as follows: Clustering is one of the most important techniques to be performed in the Arabic language to solve the tokenization problem. Clustering as a general approach to dealing with problems of language sparseness and morphological analysis is promising. Use large amounts of parallel corpus data to train the proposed model to achieve better results. Use large amounts of data for tuning from the same area of training data to achieve better tuning results. Every time this model is tuned, better results can be achieved so that it would be better to align it as possible. Use test data from the same area of training to achieve better neural results with other learning networks.
